channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.description:

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

item.title: Report X-2024040973
item.description:
Report X-2024040973

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION ONE BOTTLE OF FOUR BOTTLES OF NOBLE DEGREASER HD WAS FOUND FULLY LEAKED OUT. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF NOBLE DEGREASER HD COULD CAUSE FROM THE PACKAGE BEING MISHANDLED OR DROPPED DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION ONE OF THREE BOTTLES OF ISOPROPANOL WAS FOUND TO BE CRACKED AND FULLY LEAKED OUT. THE REAMINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE SCRAPPED UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE THE PACKAGE COULD CAUSE FROM IT BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION

  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE, UPON INSPECTION 1 BOTTLE OF PART B RAPICIDE WAS FOUND TO BE MISSING AND ONE CAP SLIGHTY LOOSE CAUSING IT LEAK. PART A WAS PRESENT ALL THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE SCRAPPED UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF RAPICIDE COULD CAUSE FROM PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 10 and MitigateEffect: REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

Damage most likely caused from being placed on wrong conveyor belt. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be disposed of because they are damaged from leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024040728
item.description:
Report X-2024040728

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-14
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/14/2024 at approximately 2000, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 435751 at the hub facilty in Newark, reporting a consumer commodity spill. The shipment consisted of one plastic jerrican packaged in a fiberboard box. The jerrican appeared to have leaked from the top, resulting in spillage. The cause of the spillage is unknown. Further investigation revealed that the shipment's commoidty was actually UN1170 Ethanon solution, and not ID8000 Consumer commodity. The shipment was classifed incorrectly. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024040794
item.description:
Report X-2024040794

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-13
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat cage in non-spill container. There were vague signs of leakage which appeared to be from loose caps on 2 of the contents. All caps were checked and tightened, and contents were placed in a lined salvage drum. DescribePack: The failure was determined to be caused by loosed caps. No punctures were found on any of the leaked bottles. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: All caps and bottles were checked, secured and placed in lined salvage drum awaiting disposition information.

item.title: Report X-2024040793
item.description:
Report X-2024040793

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-13
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The contents came to Hazmat in a non-spill bin at the beginning of day sort with signs of damages. Upon inspection of the package and its contents, one of the four bottles was found with a missing cap. The cap was then found at the bottom of the container and was replaced on the open bottle. Contents were then placed in a lined salvage drum awaiting disposition. DescribePack: Package failure was due to loose/missing cap on plastic bottle. An average amount of 3/4 of the contents was leaked out. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: After inspecting the package and its contents, all caps were checked and tightened, and they were then properly placed in a lined salvage drum to avoid any further damages or spillage.

  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE PACKAGE CAR BY THE NORTH BERGEN CENTER FOR A SPILL. USED THE DECISION TREE AND CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL AND COLLECTED MATERIAL. THEN TAKEN TO THE DMP ARE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024040425
item.description:
Report E-2024040425

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: N BRUNSWICK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 8, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1719 leaked on the trailer and released approximately fifty (50) gallons of product to the trailer interior, adjacent freight, and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel closed the valve to prevent further spill. FCE deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and swept them in with hand tools. All UN1719-impacted material was collected and containerized into four (4) 55-gallon poly drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024040598
item.description:
Report X-2024040598

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM THE SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO THE EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET. THE GLASS BOTTLES WERE LEFT IN DOT APPROVED YELLOW SALAVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DURING THE TWILIGHT SHIFT 4X 4 LITERS (GLASS BOTTLES) HONEYWELL RIEDEL-DE-HAEN UN2056 Tetrahydrofuran 2 OF THE GLASS BOTTLES WERE BROKEN CAUSED LEAKAGING ALLOWING 100% SPILLAGE. WHICH ALSO CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING AS WELL AND WAS THROWN OUT. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024040571
item.description:
Report X-2024040571

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE JERRICAN WAS WET AND HAD SOME LIQUID LEAKING FROM IT. THE MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I THEN REPACKED IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER. APPROXIMATELY 1 CUP LEAKED DUE TO A PUNCTURE/HOLE ON THE SIDE WALL ON THE JERRICAN. WAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH AT THE MOMENT. DescribePack: THERE IS A PUNCTURE/HOLE ON THE SIDE WALL NEAR THE TOP OF THE JERRICAN WHICH THEN CAUSED APPROXIMATELY 1 CUP OF DEGREASER TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY AND THEN IMMEDIATELY CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK IN INTO A YELLOW SALVGE DRUM IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER.
